item.title: All NASA News - NASA
item.description: Stay up-to-date with the latest content from NASA as we explore the universe and discover more about our home planet.

item.title: NASA News
item.description: Resources for news media, including NASA news contacts and archived news material

item.title: NASA Sets Coverage for Agency’s SpaceX Crew-12 Launch, Docking - NASA
item.description: Editor’s Note: This advisory was updated Feb. 10, 2026, to reflect changes to NASA’s live launch coverage for the agency’s SpaceX Crew-12 mission. Teams now

item.title: 2026 News Releases - NASA
item.description: Sign up to receive NASA news releases and other information.

item.title: Crew-12 Targets Friday Launch as Expedition 74 Keeps Up Tech, Psych Research - NASA
item.description: NASA and SpaceX managers continue targeting no earlier than 5:15 a.m. EST on Friday, Feb. 13, for the launch of Crew-12 aboard a SpaceX Dragon to the International Space Station.

item.title: Cardiac and Psychology Research on Station as Crew-12 Adjusts Launch Date - NASA
item.description: NASA and SpaceX have completed a weather review and have waived off Crew-12’s Thursday, Feb. 12, launch opportunity to the International Space Station due to unfavorable forecasted weather conditions. Meanwhile, the Expedition 74 crew focused on astronaut health research, cargo operations, and lab maintenance.

item.title: NASA’s Perseverance Rover Completes First AI-Planned Drive on Mars
item.description: The team for the six-wheeled scientist used a vision-capable AI to create a safe route over the Red Planet’s surface without the input of human route planners.

item.title: NASA-ISRO Radar Mission Peers Through Clouds to See Mississippi River Delta
item.description: A new image from the NISAR mission shows off the satellite’s ability to reveal details of Earth’s surfaces. The science team also released new sample data.

item.title: NASA Analysis Shows La Niña Limited Sea Level Rise in 2025
item.description: A mild La Niña caused greater rainfall over the Amazon basin, which offset rising sea levels due to record warming of Earth’s oceans.

item.title: Networks Keeping NASA’s Artemis II Mission Connected
item.description: Artemis missions rely on both the Near Space Network, managed by NASA Goddard, and the Deep Space Network, managed by the Jet Propulsion Laboratory.

item.title: NASA’s Juno Measures Thickness of Europa’s Ice Shell
item.description: Results from the solar-powered spacecraft provide a new measurement of the thickness of the ice shell encasing the Jovian moon’s ocean.

item.title: How NASA Is Homing in From Space on Ocean Debris
item.description: Space-based technology could help track plastic and other flotsam by its ‘fingerprints.’

item.title: NASA Reveals New Details About Dark Matter’s Influence on Universe
item.description: With the Webb telescope’s unprecedented sensitivity, scientists are learning more about dark matter’s influence on stars, galaxies, and even planets like Earth.

item.title: NASA’s SunRISE SmallSats Ace Tests, Moving Closer to Launch
item.description: The small satellites passed a crucible of tests, ending with a simulation of the intense vibrations of launch.

item.title: NASA, SpaceX Launch US-European Satellite to Monitor Earth’s Oceans
item.description: Sentinel-6B will extend a decades-long legacy of global sea level measurements that help forecast weather, protect coastal communities, and more.

item.description: Throughout November, the Terran R program made key advancements across design, build, test, and launch operations. item.title: SES, Relativity Space Expand Multi-Launch Agreement for Terran R
item.description: New contract adds launch services for SES’s GEO or MEO satellites
